disease: Gonococcal infection of anus and rectum

symptoms.name: Rectal symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May be asymptomatic in up to 80% of cases

Gram stain.abnormal: Visualization of gram-negative diplococci (sensitivity 90-95% in men with urethral discharge, lower sensitivity in women and for pharyngeal specimens)

risk_factors: Sexual activity with an infected person without using condoms or oral dams

required: Positive culture for Neisseria gonorrhoeae from rectal specimen
Positive NAAT for Neisseria gonorrhoeae from rectal specimen
supportive: Gram stain showing gram-negative diplococci (lower sensitivity)
